alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Inland Bay; Inland Wakulla; Jackson; Liberty; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Jackson, northeastern Bay and Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, northwestern Wakulla, west central Gadsden, Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida and northeastern Washington Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 445 PM EDT/345 PM CDT/... At 349 PM EDT/249 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Marianna to 14 miles north of Carrabelle. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blountstown, Marianna, Orange, Bradford, Sneads, Bristol, Grand Ridge, Altha, Alford, Rock Bluff, Jewel Fire Tower, Moose Pond, Clarksville, Ocheesee, Selman, Abe Springs, Vilas, Central City, Chipola and Camps Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Gadsden; Inland Bay; Inland Wakulla; Jackson; Liberty; Washington
